doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Davidson Sommers held on July 18, 1985
doc.abstracts: In July 1985, Davidson Sommers was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1946 to 1959, Mr. Sommers worked in the following areas: in the law department as a lawyer and also as assistant general counsel starting in 1946; as general counsel (1949-1959); and as vice president for the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD and the International Finance Corporation (IFC) (1956-1959). His transcript concerns the issuance of bonds and other legal barriers approached by the World Bank, the growing independence of the International Finance Corporation (IFC), and the presidencies of John McCloy and Eugene Black
